dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4389 IH: Migratory Birds of the Americas Conservation Enhancements Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Salazar (for herself, Mr. Larsen of Washington, Mr. Joyce of Ohio, and Mrs. Peltola) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act to make improvements to that Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Migratory Birds of the Americas Conservation Enhancements Act of 2023.

section.header: Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act amendments

subsection.text: Section 5(e)(1) of the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 6104(e)(1)) is amended by striking 25 percent and inserting 33.3 percent.
Section 7 of the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 6106) is amended by adding at the end the following:

Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of the Migratory Birds of the Americas Conservation Enhancements Act of 2023, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives a report describing the implementation of subsection (b) by the Secretary, which shall include, if applicable, a description of the composition of the advisory group convened under paragraph (1) of that subsection.

subsection.header: Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Fund administrative expenses
subsection.text: Section 9(c)(2) of the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 6108(c)(2)) is amended by striking 3 percent or up to $100,000 and inserting 4 percent or up to $200,000.
Section 10(a) of the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 6109(a)) is amended to read as follows:
There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act—

paragraph.text: Section 4 of the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 6103) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (2) through (5) as paragraphs (1) through (4), respectively.

paragraph.text: Section 7(b)(1) of the Neotropical Migratory Bird Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 6106(b)(1)) is amended in the second sentence by adding a period at the end.
